intro: Leretia nitida, commonly known as the silverleaf lantana, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Verbenaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. The plant has narrow, silver-gray leaves that give it its common name, and it thrives in well-drained soil. It is often used in gardens for its ornamental value and ability to attract pollinators. Leretia nitida is drought-tolerant and prefers full sun to partial shade.
